issue.title: [CF 1103] UnitID question
issue.body:
Basically I'm trying to track a spell cooldown of a certain target. It works if I fill in the specific name of the (enemy) target but the problem is that I want to do it for a certain variable/list. I don't know anything about LUA programming but when I typ /script print(name1) the exact name of the target does show up but my question is if there is a way to call this variable and make it fill in as unitID.

Hope you understand my question, else I can formulate it differently. Thank you.


> Posted by CurseForge user daniel1992 | Imported from CurseForge issue #1103 | Raw

comments.body:
Use Unit Conditions to track only specific units. For example, if you want to track something on your target, but only if your target is named Steve, then add a Unit Name condition to the Unit Conditions to check that the name of your target is Steve.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I meant more like, the names are stored in a dictionary/variable (not sure what it's called) in the BGT addon which I made global, I could typ print(ENEMY_Data[1]) and it would print the name of the first enemy in BGT. It it possible to use this variable in TMW?


> Posted by CurseForge user daniel1992

Enemy names aren't unitIDs, so even if you could do what you are asking (you can't), it wouldn't matter, because it wouldn't work anyway.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
